definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent

sentences.english: Beware, however, of making all your code a series of templates.
sentences.chinese: 不過，要謹防讓所有代碼成爲一系列模板。

sentences.english: The purchaser signing the subscription document must be cautious and avoid falling into the trap.
sentences.chinese: 購買人簽定樓宇認購書應謹防誤入陷阱。

sentences.english: Thus, you should be on guard against this confused mapping.
sentences.chinese: 因此，您應該謹防這種有混淆的映射。

sentences.english: Beware of paid survey scam websites.
sentences.chinese: 謹防付費調查詐騙網站。

sentences.english: She takes caution for cowardice and dissent for defiance.
sentences.chinese: 她謹防懦夫的暗箭，從挑釁中挖掘異議。
謹防過度強調宣傳物品。

sentences.english: Please remember the sign of the Minlongda brand, and be ware of imitations .
sentences.chinese: 承蒙惠顧，請認準閩龍達商標標誌，謹防假冒。

sentences.english: High-end liquor prices must be on guard against false wine, for looking up.
sentences.chinese: 高端白酒持續漲價，須謹防假酒擡頭。

sentences.english: The conductor reminded passengers to keep on guard against the thief.
sentences.chinese: 售票員提醒乘客謹防小偷。

sentences.english: Beware of dishonest traders in the tourist areas.
sentences.chinese: 在旅遊區一定要謹防奸商。

sentences.english: Muscles tense from slipping on ice, people get moody, think bad thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 緊繃的肌肉謹防着從冰上滑倒，人們變得思想陰鬱。

sentences.english: Organizations should watch for three common misuses of data.
sentences.chinese: 企業應謹防三類常見的數據誤用。
